column1: Laiwu (simplified Chinese: 莱芜; traditional Chinese: 萊蕪; pinyin: Láiwú) was a prefecture-level city in central Shandong Province
column2: China. Bordered the provincial capital of Jinan to the north
column3: Zibo to the east and Tai'an to the southwest
column4: it was the smallest prefecture-level city in the province. It had a population of 1
column7: and became part of Jinan in 2019.

column1: The prefecture-level city of Laiwu administered two county-level divisions
Laicheng District (莱城区; 萊城區)
Gangcheng District (钢城区; 鋼城區)They were further divided into 19 township-level divisions

column3: Laiwu has become a district of Jinan which is the capital city of Shandong province
column4: and is no longer a prefecture-level city any more.
